summary: more efficient and random listing for weapons
descriptionHtml:
See videos for a tutorial on adding weapons.

Changes in v1.1:
Draugr use separate shield lists
Archers may carry 1handed weapons instead of just daggers
Bandit chiefs can be archers
Dual-wielding is now available to all actors
A few redundant changes to insure random distribution

This resource will make adding new weapons to levelled lists much simpler, all you have to do is make the item in Weapons and then drop it in the corresponding list (ex. WeaponSteel1H for 1-handed steel weapons) and they will be included in the levelled list for any that use it, meaning all actors (characters), vendors, chests and rewards.

[b]Leveled list progress finished for v1.0.[/b]

Introduces branching of weapons (Any -> 1H -> Iron ->Sword) rather than big jumbled lists in vanilla.

List legend:
IronSteel means includes only iron and steel weapons and shields
Bandit means weapons up to Elven and iron/steel shields
Standard means weapons and shields up to ebony
Dae means all the way up to Daedric
1H 1-handed
2H 2-handed
DW Dual-wield
1HS 1-handed with shield
Archer sets include a bow, arrows and a dagger

I can\'t include Dragonbone weapons as my CK crashes any time I try to use Dawnguard; so if anyone wants to add those in they are welcome; however, I don\'t believe dragonbone, dragonscale and the dragonbone weapons should be in the leveled lists at all just for lore\'s sake.

This will also allow for ratios to be calculated easier, you can just duplicate a sublist to make it more common.  If you have a sublist of iron 1handed weapons, 1 sword, 1 axe and 1 mace you can duplicate the sword and make it go from 33% chance to 50%.
This allows for more combinations of weapons that you will encounter, ex. a bandit duel wielding an iron sword and an orcish axe.
This still maintains vanilla limits (bandits only have up to Elven, etc.) with a few tweaks to make the game more balanced.

v0.1 only has the lists and branches, no leveled lists yet
author: mrjentipede
